title: Interesting alternatives to Bitstream Aurora Bold Condensed?
content:
I'm laying out a poster and in terms of a condensed font, Bitstream Aurora Bold Condensed really has the size and weight I'm looking for. It just doesn't have the right "feel" somehow though as a typeface.

As kind of a shot in the dark, I'm wondering if anyone has any suggestions of any other typefaces of similar size and weight I might look into. Am sort of wide-open in terms of going with something classic or modern at this point--the poster could go in either direction.

Here's a link to this font:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/aurora/bold-condensed/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110413081024/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/aurora/bold-condensed/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/aurora/bold-condensed/")
author: tomjonesrocks

comments.content: There are quite a few different directions you could go with a similar weight and size... Akzidenz Grotesk Bold Condensed and Railroad Gothic come to mind.

The following are listed as cross-references under the Aurora entry in [FontBook](http://web.archive.org/web/20110413081024/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontBook):

[Bigticy](http://web.archive.org/web/20110413081024/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/presence_typo/bigticy_plain/)  
 [Compacta](http://web.archive.org/web/20110413081024/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Compacta)  
 [Hadrian](http://web.archive.org/web/20110413081024/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/hadrian_bold/)  
 [Placard](http://web.archive.org/web/20110413081024/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Placard)  
 [Anzeigen Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20110413081024/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/anzeigen_grotesk/)
